intro: Chiloschista gelephuense, commonly known as the Himalayan snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered with a fine pubescence, while its stems are usually erect and somewhat woody. Chiloschista gelephuense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
